Grilled Chicken with Quinoa Salad

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a culinary delight that perfectly marries health and flavor: Grilled Chicken with Quinoa Salad! This vibrant dish is not only packed with protein from the juicy grilled chicken breast but also brimming with nutrients from the colorful quinoa salad. Quinoa, often hailed as a superfood, is a fantastic source of complete protein and fiber, making it a perfect match for your grilled chicken. The fresh ingredients like diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and bright parsley not only add texture but also a refreshing burst of flavor to every bite. Whether you're looking for a satisfying weeknight dinner or a nutritious meal prep option, this recipe is sure to impress. Plus, the ease of grilling chicken while simultaneously preparing a light salad makes this dish a winner for both novice cooks and seasoned chefs alike. Dive into this healthy recipe that celebrates wholesome eating without sacrificing taste!

Ingredients

chicken breast

Choose skinless, boneless chicken breasts for a healthier option. For enhanced flavor, marinate the chicken in olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and herbs for at least 30 minutes before grilling. If you don't have chicken breast, you can substitute with thighs or even tofu for a vegetarian option.

quinoa

Rinse quinoa thoroughly before cooking to remove its natural coating, which can taste bitter. Use vegetable or chicken broth instead of water for cooking to add more flavor. If you don’t have quinoa, you can use couscous or farro as a substitute.

cucumber

Choose firm cucumbers and peel them if you prefer a milder taste. For added crunch, consider using Persian cucumbers, which are smaller and seedless. If cucumber is unavailable, zucchini can be a refreshing alternative.

cherry tomatoes

Select plump, vibrant cherry tomatoes for sweetness. Roasting them for a few minutes can intensify their flavor, or you can substitute with grape tomatoes or even diced regular tomatoes if needed.

red onion

Soaking chopped red onion in cold water for 10-15 minutes can reduce its sharpness, making it milder and sweeter. If red onion is not available, use shallots or green onions as alternatives.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. You can infuse the oil with herbs or garlic for extra depth. If olive oil is not available, avocado oil or canola oil can be good substitutes.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is preferable for a brighter taste. You can also add some lemon zest for extra citrus flavor. If fresh lemons are unavailable, bottled lemon juice can be used in a pinch, but use less as it can be more concentrated.

salt

Use kosher salt for seasoning as it dissolves easily and enhances flavor without over-salting. If you are watching sodium intake, consider using low-sodium salt or seasoning blends.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper provides a more robust flavor than pre-ground. Experiment with different types of peppercorns like white or pink for unique flavor profiles.

parsley

Fresh parsley brightens the dish; chop it coarsely for a rustic look or finely for a refined touch. If unavailable, cilantro or basil can serve as flavorful substitutes.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Grill

    Start by preheating your grill to medium-high heat (about 350°F to 400°F). This ensures that the chicken cooks evenly and develops a nice char.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Chicken

    Take the chicken breasts and coat them with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Use about 1 tablespoon of olive oil for both breasts, and season generously with salt and pepper to enhance flavor.

  • Step 3: Grill the Chicken

    Place the seasoned chicken breasts on the grill. Grill for about 6-7 minutes on each side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) and juices run clear. Avoid flipping the chicken too often to allow for good grill marks.

  • Step 4: Cook the Quinoa

    While the chicken is grilling, rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water to remove its natural coating, saponin, which can make it taste bitter. Cook the quinoa according to package instructions, typically by adding it to 2 cups of boiling water, reducing the heat to low, and simmering for about 15 minutes.

  • Step 5: Prepare the Salad

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, finely chopped red onion, and chopped parsley. Toss gently to mix all the ingredients.

  • Step 6: Make the Dressing

    In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. This dressing will brighten up the salad.

  • Step 7: Combine the Salad and Dressing

    Pour the dressing over the quinoa salad and mix well to ensure even coating. Adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper as desired.

  • Step 8: Rest the Chicken

    Once the chicken is done cooking, remove it from the grill and let it rest for about 5 minutes. This helps the juices redistribute, making the chicken more tender.

  • Step 9: Slice and Serve

    After resting, slice the grilled chicken breasts and serve them over a generous bed of quinoa salad. This dish is great warm or at room temperature.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I safely handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw chicken. Use separate cutting boards and utensils for raw chicken to avoid cross-contamination with other foods.

What is quinoa and how do I cook it?

Quinoa is a nutritious grain-like seed. To cook it, rinse it under cold water to remove bitterness, then combine 1 cup quinoa with 2 cups water or broth in a pot. Bring it to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for about 15 minutes until the liquid is absorbed.

How can I tell when the chicken is fully cooked?

The safest way to check chicken is by using a meat thermometer. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (75°C). If you don’t have a thermometer, ensure the juices run clear when you cut into the chicken, and there’s no pink meat inside.

What can I use instead of olive oil for grilling?

You can use other oils with high smoke points like canola oil, avocado oil, or grapeseed oil. These will also add a nice flavor to your grilled chicken.

Why do I need to let the chicken rest after grilling?

Letting the chicken rest allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, making it juicier and more flavorful when you slice into it.

How can I make my quinoa salad more flavorful?

You can add herbs like basil or cilantro, spices like cumin or paprika, or additional vegetables like bell peppers or corn to enhance the flavor of your quinoa salad.

What is the best way to chop vegetables?

Start by washing and peeling (if necessary) your vegetables. Use a sharp knife, and cut them into uniform sizes for even cooking. For the cucumber, cut it in half lengthwise and then dice it into small pieces.

How do I properly season my food?

Start with a small amount of salt and pepper, and taste as you go. You can always add more seasoning, but it's hard to fix over-seasoned food. Remember that the flavors will develop more as the dish cooks.

Can I prepare this recipe ahead of time?

Yes! You can grill the chicken and cook the quinoa in advance. Store them separately in the fridge and combine them just before serving to keep everything fresh.

Is it necessary to use fresh herbs like parsley?

While fresh herbs add vibrant flavor and color, you can substitute dried herbs if fresh isn't available. Use about 1 teaspoon of dried herbs in place of 1 tablespoon of fresh.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free and can easily be made dairy-free. For a vegetarian option, substitute the grilled chicken with grilled tofu or tempeh, and for a vegan version, remove the chicken entirely and add more vegetables or legumes to the quinoa salad. Ensure that the quinoa is certified gluten-free if necessary.

Pairings

For an ideal pairing, consider serving the grilled chicken with a light, crisp white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing rosé. If you prefer a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling water with a squeeze of lemon or a herbal iced tea can complement the dish well. For added protein, grilled shrimp or a side of roasted chickpeas can be served alongside the salad.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the grilled chicken sliced on top of the quinoa salad for an appealing presentation. Garnish with additional fresh parsley and lemon wedges for a pop of color and flavor. For a casual gathering, consider serving the dish in a large bowl for family-style dining or in individual portions for a more elegant setting. Pair with crusty whole-grain bread or pita for added texture.

Grilled Chicken with Quinoa Salad

35 min
$12.5
450 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 2

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinGluten FreeHealthy

Cuisine:

AmericanMediterranean

Course:

Main CourseSalad

Tags:

EasyQuickGrilledSalad

Description

A light and refreshing dish packed with protein and wholesome grains, perfect for a quick dinner.

Ingredients

  • chicken breast: 2 pieces
  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • cucumber: 1, diced
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup, halved
  • red onion: 1/4, finely chopped
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • parsley: 1/4 cup, chopped

Date Created:

11/17/2024
